intro: Dolicholobium, commonly known as the long-horned milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers and hairy, elongated stems. The leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a rough texture. Dolicholobium species are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in grassy or wooded areas. These plants contain latex, which can be toxic to livestock and humans if ingested.
